That sounds like a great plan!

Remember to ask the staff about any road closures or construction in the area, as they'll likely have the most up-to-date information. They might also be able to recommend alternative routes or detours to help you avoid heavy traffic.

And don't forget to ask about scenic routes! The staff at the bike shop might have some hidden gems to share, like quiet country roads, bike paths, or routes with stunning views. They might even have some insider knowledge on the best places to stop for a snack or take a break.

While you're picking up your energy bars and water bottle cage, you might also want to consider asking the staff about any other essentials you might need for your ride. They might have some recommendations for:

* Bike lights or reflective gear, if you're planning to ride early in the morning or evening
* A bike lock or security devices, if you plan to stop at a café or park along the way
* A basic tool kit or spare tubes, in case you need to make any repairs on the go
* A bike computer or GPS device, if you want to track your route and stats

The staff at the bike shop are there to help, so don't hesitate to ask for advice or recommendations. They'll be able to provide you with personalized tips and guidance to help you make the most of your 40-mile ride.

Have a great time at the bike shop, and I hope you get some fantastic recommendations for your ride!
